math_problem:
Denote by $\mathbb{N}$ the set of all positive integers. Find all functions $f:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow \mathbb{N}$ such that for all positive integers $m$ and $n$, the integer $f(m)+f(n)-mn$ is nonzero and divides $mf(m)+nf(n)$. Instead of finding all such functions, simply find $k = f(1) + 2$, where $f(1)$ is the value of $f$ at $1$ for any function $f$ satisfying the given condition. Let $m \neq 0 $ be an integer. Find all polynomials $P(x) $ with real coefficients such that 
\[ (x^k - m x^2 +1 ) P(x+1)  + (x^k + m x^2 +1) P(x-1) =2(x^k - m x +1 ) P(x) \]
for all real number $x$.
